alert.note: Alert for Washington (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 3:37PM PST until January 30 at 5:06AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Tualatin River at Farmington affecting Washington County. Luckiamute River near Suver affecting Benton and Polk Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tualatin River at Farmington. * WHEN...From this evening to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Above 32.0 feet, expect flooding of numerous fields and low-lying farms, along with flooding of a few secondary roads in and around Farmington and Tualatin. Some farmland near the river channel will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM PST Saturday the stage was 31.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 32.3 feet late tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 600 AM PST.
